@ zomboah: are we talking about in the USA?  The answer is yes and not yes as one law school professor put it.  The US Supreme Court did decide that virtual child pornography was protected speech.  However, they left open the idea that particular works could be found to be "obscene."  As a practical matter, obscenity laws amount to "whatever the prosecutor finds offensive will be found to be obscene if the judge / jury agrees"  So, while loli hentai is constitutionally protected free speech, if you get caught with it a moralist or an SJW can prosecute you for it being obscene.  Obscenity laws are BS and have their origins in anti-blasphemy laws but that was moved away from in favor of anti-porn quite a while back.  It's weird that being against porn is basically the only truly bi-partisan stance in the USA when pretty much everyone looks at porn.
